musicalLanguage.description: The iconic driving piano riff that defines modern alternative pop. Built on a rapid arpeggiated pattern cycling through Eb, Bbm, and Fm chords. The left hand provides a steady bass anchor while the right hand plays the signature ascending broken chord figure.
musicalLanguage.structure: Riff pattern (8 bars) — Eb-Bbm-Fm cycle with repetition
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: The Eb major riff — the signature ascending pattern that everyone recognizes
Bars 3-4: Bb minor — the riff darkens, creating tension
Bars 5-6: F minor — the third chord of the cycle completes the harmonic circuit
teachingGoals: Rapid arpeggiated right-hand patterns at tempo
Maintaining steady pulse with the left hand while the right hand moves
Playing in a flat key — Eb major with Bb and Ab
styleTips: The right hand should be percussive but flowing — like a clock mechanism
Keep strict time — this riff lives or dies by its rhythmic precision
Left hand stays simple and grounded while right hand drives the energy

measures.rightHand: Bb4:e G4:e Eb4:e Bb4:e G4:e Eb4:e Bb4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: The iconic riff begins — Bb-G-Eb pattern repeating. Keep it crisp and even.

measures.rightHand: Bb4:e G4:e Eb4:e Bb4:e G4:e Eb4:e Bb4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: Same pattern — lock into the groove. Consistency is everything here.

measures.rightHand: Bb4:e F4:e Db4:e Bb4:e F4:e Db4:e Bb4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: Bb minor — same rhythmic pattern but Db replaces Eb, F replaces G. Feel the darkness.

measures.rightHand: Bb4:e F4:e Db4:e Bb4:e F4:e Db4:e Bb4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: Bb minor continues — keep the momentum relentless.

measures.rightHand: Ab4:e F4:e C4:e Ab4:e F4:e C4:e Ab4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: F minor — the third chord. Ab-F-C pattern. The cycle is nearly complete.

measures.rightHand: Ab4:e F4:e C4:e Ab4:e F4:e C4:e Ab4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: F minor repeats — you're now hearing the full chord cycle.

measures.rightHand: Bb4:e G4:e Eb4:e Bb4:e G4:e Eb4:e Bb4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: Back to Eb major — the return feels like coming home. The cycle begins again.

measures.rightHand: Bb4:e G4:e Eb4:e Bb4:e G4:e Eb4:e Bb4:q
measures.teachingNote: Final bar — the last note is a quarter note, giving the phrase a slight landing before looping.
